title: ‘Bye Bridget’: Somerville bakery claps back at internet ‘troll’ with a line of merch
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Somerville's Hearth & Hug Bakery launches 'Bye Bridget' merchandise after troll criticism over charity donations.
The bakery donates sales to food banks and supports initiatives aiding immigrants, LGBTQ+ youth, and homelessness issues.
Proceeds from 'Bye Bridget' merchandise will also benefit charities, continuing the bakery's philanthropic efforts.

title: ‘Keep their light on in our world’: Daughter remembers Eastham couple who fell through ice
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Gerard and Kathleen Boucher died after falling through ice at Bee's River, Eastham on February 14.
Daughter Katy Boucher remembers her parents for their community dedication and invites others to help in their honor.
Memorial services for the Bouchers will be held at St. Joan of Arc Church in Orleans on February 27 and 28.

title: 3 fires being investigated as arson in Fitchburg, officials say
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Three fires in Fitchburg homes are under investigation as arson, according to State Fire Marshal Jon Davine.
Fires occurred on Feb. 14 and 15 at a large apartment building and on Feb. 18 in a multi-family home.
Officials urge the public to report suspicious activity and offer a reward up to $5,000 for arson-related information.

title: Eric Dane, ‘Grey’s Anatomy’ star and ALS awareness advocate, dies at 53
author: The Associated Press
bullets: Actor Eric Dane, known for 'Grey's Anatomy' and 'Euphoria,' died at 53 from amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS).
Dane became an ALS awareness advocate following his diagnosis in 2025, earning an Advocate of the Year award in September.
He is survived by his wife, Rebecca Gayheart, and daughters Billie and Georgia; a memoir will be published posthumously.

title: 4 Mass. State Police troopers charged in death of recruit suspended with pay
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Four Massachusetts State Police troopers charged in the death of recruit Enrique Delgado-Garcia were suspended with pay.
The charges include causing serious bodily injury and involuntary manslaughter, with Lt. Jennifer Penton also facing perjury charges.
An independent review of Massachusetts State Police training practices by the International Association of Chiefs of Police is nearing completion.

title: Braintree police warn public about planned ‘takeover’ at South Shore Plaza
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Braintree police warn of a planned 'takeover' at South Shore Plaza, scheduled through a social media post for Friday evening.
Officers alerted on Tuesday have developed an operational plan and are coordinating with law enforcement partners to ensure safety.
Previous takeovers involved illegal street activities; legislation proposed to confiscate vehicles and penalize reckless driving.

title: Kendrick Perkins has Celtics as ‘dark horse’ to win title in 2026 — under 1 condition
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Kendrick Perkins sees the Celtics as a 2026 title dark horse if Jayson Tatum returns from an Achilles injury.
The Celtics are second in the Eastern Conference with a 35-19 record despite major offseason departures.
Perkins highlights Jaylen Brown's MVP-caliber performance, calling him the best two-way player in the NBA.

title: What would it take for the Patriots to land AJ Brown? ESPN analyst cooked up a hypothetical trade.
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: ESPN's hypothetical trade suggests Patriots exchange a 2026 first, third, and sixth-round pick for AJ Brown and a 2026 second-round pick.
AJ Brown had a slightly underwhelming season in 2025, with 1,003 yards, but remains a top receiver under contract until 2029.
The trade would still leave Patriots with dual second-round picks and multiple other mid-round selections in the 2026 draft.

title: Why Kyle Pitts could be the Patriots’ top free-agent target
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Kyle Pitts recorded 88 catches for 928 yards and five touchdowns with the Atlanta Falcons in 2025.
Pitts, projected at a $17.5 million annual cap hit, may be a more affordable target for the Patriots.
The Patriots aim to enhance their offense, particularly by adding a dynamic pass-catcher like Kyle Pitts.

title: Provincetown man pleads guilty to possessing, distributing thousands of child porn files
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Laurence Pagnoni, 65, from Provincetown, pleaded guilty to child pornography charges in federal court, including possession and distribution.
Pagnoni was investigated after a suspect reported receiving child abuse material from him via the MEGA platform.
Pagnoni's sentencing is set for May 12, with each charge carrying up to 20 years in prison and a fine up to $250,000.
